alert.note: Alert for Addison; Chittenden; Lamoille; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 5:24PM EDT until May 21 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Essex County in northern New York... Southwestern Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... North central Addison County in central Vermont... Central Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Northwestern Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Willsboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Essex, Willsboro, Charlotte, Stowe, Waterbury Village, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Bolton, Richmond, Mt. Philo State Park, Jericho, Hinesburg, St. George, Huntington, Duxbury and Moretown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Champlain should seek safe harbor now! Strong winds will cause higher waves and sudden wind shifts may overturn boats. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
